com.weeryan17.utilities.api

Class CustomRecipe

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.weeryan17.utilities.api.CustomRecipe

  • public class CustomRecipe
extends java.lang.Object
    Allows you to create recipes where only specific items can be used.
    Author:
    weeryan17

      • defineOutput

        public void defineOutput(org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack result)
        Defines what will come out of the crafting process. This should ALLWAYS be called first.
        Parameters:
        result -

      • shape

        public void shape(java.lang.String top,
         java.lang.String middle,
         java.lang.String bottom)
        Defines the shape of the items. same as how you would use the bukkit system.
        Parameters:
        top - The pattern for the top row.
        midle - The pattern for the middle row.
        bottom - The pattern for the bottom row.

      • setIngredient

        public void setIngredient(char key,
                 org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack item)
        Set's items to be used in what spot during crafting. Same as the bukkit system
        Parameters:
        key - The key defined when you set the pattern.
        item - The item to be used.

      • storeRecipe

        public void storeRecipe()
        Acutely stores the recipe for use in events

      • isPluginRecipe

        public static boolean isPluginRecipe(org.bukkit.inventory.Recipe recipe)
        Checks if the given recipe is stored in the plugin.
        Parameters:
        recipe - The recipe you want to check.
        Returns:
        a boolean representing if the recipe is contained in the plugin.

      • getRecipeByRecipe

        public static CustomRecipe getRecipeByRecipe(org.bukkit.inventory.Recipe recipe)
        Get's the defined custom recipe based on a Bukkit recipe.
        Parameters:
        recipe - The recipe you want to get the custom recipe from.
        Returns:
        The custom recipe. null if it isn't a part of this plugin.
